content.title: Plant Protection including Integrated Pest Management Scheme
content.department: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya
content.details: The “Plant Protection including Integrated Pest Management (IPM) Scheme” is a State Plan Scheme, which is implemented by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya. The objective of the scheme is to mobilize and support farmers to use bio-pesticides and bio-agents for plant health management through the distribution of bio-pesticides and other IPM tools and through the sale of Sprayers and Plant Protection Equipment to encourage organic crop production.
benefits: Distribution of bio-pesticide and other IPM tools to farmers.
Sale of Sprayers and Plant Protection Equipment.
Free distribution of Bio-pesticides and other IPM tools.
50% subsidy sale on Plant Protection Equipment.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Meghalaya.
The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in agriculture.
content.application_process: Offline. The eligible bonafide farmers can apply/write an application on plain paper and submit it at the nearest office of the Agriculture Development Officer of a CD Block/Agriculture Circle.
documents_required: Documents proof of having sufficient available cultivable land

faqs.question: What is the key objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The key objective is to mobilize and support farmers to use bio-pesticides and bio-agents for plant health management through the distribution of bio-pesticides and other IPM tools and through the sale of Sprayers and Plant Protection equipment to encourage organic crop production.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya.

faqs.question: What is the type of assistance/entitlement?
faqs.answer: Free distribution of Bio pesticides and other IPM tools; 50% subsidy sale on Plant Protection Equipment.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of assistance?
faqs.answer: Distribution of bio-pesticide and other IPM tools to farmers; Sale of Sprayers and Plant Protection Equipment.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers having cultivable land engage in agriculture can apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: How to apply for the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers can apply in plain paper through the nearest Agriculture Development Officer of a CD Block/Agriculture Circle.

faqs.question: What is the beneficiaries’ selection procedure?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers having sufficient available cultivable land shall be selected on a first come first served basis.

faqs.question: Whom to contact?
faqs.answer: District Agriculture Officers of the concerned districts; Sub-Divisional Agricultural Officers of the concerned sub-divisions; District Training Officers, Tura/Shillong; Agricultural Development Officers of the concerned Community and Rural Development Blocks.
